description.narrative: The proposed PDO is to strengthen the capacity and governance systems of key institutions for managing the minerals sector in Guinea.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Deposit initial Counterpart Funds into Project Account | Description :Deposit of US$50,000 counterpart fundinginto the Project Counterpart Account no later than three (3)months after the Effective Date, and every year thereafter until theclosing date counterpart funds equalto US$ 50,000 or such other amount as agreed by the Association. | Due Date :20-Aug-2013

Finance Agreement :Deposit ongoing Counterpart Funds into Project Account | Description :Deposit of US$50,000 counterpart fundinginto the Project Counterpart Account no later than three (3)months after the Effective Date, and every year thereafter until theclosing date counterpart funds equalto US$ 50,000 or such other amount as agreed by the Association. | Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :External auditor recruited | Description :Recruitment external independent auditor no later than three (3)months after the Effective date. | Due Date :20-Aug-2013

Finance Agreement :First work plan of activities completed. | Description :Preparation of an annual work plan and budget forproject implementation activities under satisfactory Terms of Reference. No later than one (1) month after effectiveness and byevery 31 January thereafter. | Due Date :20-Jun-2013
Finance Agreement :Independent internal auditor recruited | Description :Recruitment of an independent internal auditor no laterthan two (2) months after the Effective Date. | Due Date :20-Jul-2013

Finance Agreement :Mining expert recruited | Description :The recruitment of a Mining Expert to complement the members of theProject Implementation Unit in the Ministry of Mines. No later than twelve (12) months after effectiveness | Due Date :20-Apr-2014

Finance Agreement :Monitoring and evaluation specialist recruited | Description :The recruitment of a Monitoring and EvaluationSpecialist to complement the members of the ProjectImplementation Unit in the Ministry of Mines. No later than three (3) monthsafter effectiveness | Due Date :20-Apr-2014

Finance Agreement :PIU staff trained in accordance with Consultant and Procurement Guidelines. | Description :Training of the Staffof the PIU on the World Bank Consultant Guidelines and Procurement Guidelines.No later than six (6) months after effectiveness |Due Date :20-Nov-2013

Finance Agreement :Recurring work plan of activities completed. | Description :Preparation of an annual work plan and budget forproject implementation activities under satisfactory Terms of Reference. No laterthan one (1) month after effectiveness and byevery 31 January thereafter. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Strategic Environmental and Social Assessment (SESA) carried out | Description :Strategic Environmental andSocial Assessment (SESA) carried out and recommendations, together withaction plan based on the recommendations furnished to IDAfor review to be adopted no later thaneighteen (18) months after effectiveness | Due Date :20-Oct-2015

title.narrative: Regional development plans developed in at least one key mining region
Time to issue mining license (after reform)
Mines subjected to annual technical inspections in line with established standards
Mines subjected to fiscal controls per year in line with established standards
People trained on technical, financial, control and monitoring of mining ancillary infrastructure in the Ministries in charge of Mines, Transport and SOGUIPAMI.
Percentage of environmental monitoring inspections of mining activities carried out per year by Ministry of Environment with cooperation of the Prefectural Environmental Monitoring Committee
Members of mining communities who are aware of amount of social investment and government revenues supposed to be transferred to local communities and actual transfer
Number of artisanal and small scale miners who have participated in sensitization
People trained in the updated environmental legislation related to mining operations (Inspectors, Mining communities, CBOs)
Female ASMs who have participated in sensitization
Number of mining communities that have established a Prefectural Environmental Monitoring Committee
Model build-operate-transfer (BOT) convention for mining ancillary infrastructure developed and adopted.
Operational manual on mining ancillary infrastructure inspection adopted
Completion of geochemical map on 3 degrees
Decree adopted to clarify institutional relationship, responsibilities, and mandate of SOUGAPAMI vis a vis the Ministries in charge of Mines, Finance, and Transport
Mineral revenue collection administration procedures adopted
Mining ancillary infrastructure related regulations, standards updated
Publication of the amount of social investment and government revenues transferred to local communities at national and local levels
SOGUIPAMI Governance structure established and adopted
Updated and modernized mining cadastre with information accessible on-line
